issue.description: The express-G diagram has an error. Product_category_assignment.products should be a SET ! The hyperlink boxes do not line up with the diagram.

description.p: Currently both "id" and "name" are mandatory. However it is often the case that some CAD/PDM system holds internally only one string. Then these systems have to invent some random string for the other attribute. This complicates data exchange because the receiving system can not distinguish which attribute is real and which is random.
We strongly propose to have one attribute optional - our choice is to make "name" optional. Consequently "id" must be a non-empty string

comment.description: Both are required in AP214 (suggest SEDS)

description.p: To be able to distinguish products from each other it is essential that the "id" of products must be unique within some scope, e.g. an exchange file or within a database.
Add a unique rule for "id". This may be combined with id-owner.

comment.description: Uniqueness is context dependent. Different APs will require different approaches to guarantee uniqueness. The PLCS approach is to use identification assignment in order to satisfy the "The Department of Defence Guide to Uniquely Identifying Items, Version 1.3" See (http://www.acq.osd.mil/uid))

description.p: For exchange purpose, but also for data integration it is absolutely essential that the owner of the id of a product is always specified. The owner may be a person, an organization or some system. It must be a requirement for every pre-processor to ensure proper product id and id-owner.
Add an inverse attribute "id_owner" for a person_organization_assignment in the role "id_owner" to ensure that there is exactly one id-owner specified.

comment.description: PLCS has a business requirements to track the history of a product through life. A product will have multiple owners through life, therefore we cannot impose the restriction proposed.
The comment above does not address the issue raised: the request is to require that for each id the owner of the id is specified. This is not about whether a product has an owner!

description.p: It makes no sense to include this artificial entity. From an industrial practises point of view it is also clear that the attribute "products" of product_related_product_category (AIM) is defined in the wrong direction. For compatibility reasons it is not possible to modify the AIM. However for the modular ARM this is possible.
Add a new attribute "categories" as a set of 1 to many product categories to product. Update the mapping accordingly.

The proposed solution is unable to capture further information about the product categorization such as who assigned the categorization and when, who approved. Note the related comment DE-7 (in product_categorization/dvp/issues.xml) has been accepted.
Rejected - suggest submission as SEDS if commenter wishes to take further.
